intro: Xanthocephalum dracunculoides, commonly known as the yellow-headed bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It produces small, dry fruits called achenes, which are dispersed by wind. Xanthocephalum dracunculoides is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
